definition: to learn by heart/to commit to memory/to remember/to memorize in silence
silent/to write from memory
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
to devote oneself to a task in silence (idiom)

sentences.english: He knows many passages from Shakespeare by heart.
sentences.chinese: 他默记了莎士比亚的许多文句。

sentences.english: Memorization is a very concrete, basic form of thinking.
sentences.chinese: 默记是一种非常实在的基础的思维模式。

sentences.english: He started memorizing the Quran again.
sentences.chinese: 他再次开始默记古兰经。

definition: to learn by heart/to memorize
lit. ripe as a melon that rolls from its vine (idiom); fig. to know fluently/to know sth inside out/to know sth by heart
to make a copy of
to analyze/to try to figure out/to try to fathom
to copy/to transcribe
to read silently/to mouth (the words of a prayer etc)/to say to oneself/to contemplate inwardly
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
mental arithmetic/to figure out
to write from memory
to study attentively (a book)/to delve into
to know by heart (so well that you can recite it backwards)
to be well aware of sth/to understand clearly
to review (a lesson etc)
without missing a word
to deduce/to infer/an implication/same as 推演
to read in silence
